arm_group.description: effect of pentoxifylline on ICSI outcome

brief_summary.textblock:
To evaluate the effect of pentoxifylline used in preparation of semen samples that will be
      used for ICSI in infertile men complaining of mild and moderate asthenozoospermia (i.e.
      cases which does not need motility enhancement prior to ICSI) in comparison to semen samples
      without pentoxifylline preparation on the outcome of ICSI.

clinical_study.brief_title: Beneficial Effect of Adding Pentoxifylline to Processed Semen Samples on ICSI Outcome in Infertile Males

detailed_description.textblock:
The primary outcome measures were the number of oocytes retrieved, the number of oocytes
      injected, number of oocytes fertilized, fertilization rate, number of embryos and their
      quality (G1: good embryos, G2: fair embryos and G3: bad embryos), number of embryos
      transferred (ET), number of embryo sacs, embryo implantation rate, pregnancy rate and
      abortion rate for all 3 groups and pregnancy rate and abortion rate for both group (I) and
      group (II).

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  seeking ICSI for infertility

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Pyospermia, presence of antisperm antibodies. Azoospermia, severe male factor, severe
             asthenozoospermia. Past history of orchitis. Patients who received empirical
             treatment for asthenozoospermia e.g. oral Pentoxifylline, l-carnitine or antioxidants
             during the past 3 to 6 month. Diabetics, hypertensives or patients with any other
             chronic systemic illnesses. Wife's age more than 35 years. Low antral count. Presence
             of any ovarian factor contributing to infertility e.g. polycystic ovaries.

intervention.description: semen processing with pentoxifylline prior to ICSI
intervention.intervention_name: effect of pentoxifylline on ICSI outcome

clinical_study.official_title: Beneficial Effect of Adding Pentoxifylline to Processed Semen Samples on ICSI Outcome in Infertile Males With Mild and Moderate Asthenozoospermia: Randomized Controlled Prospective Crossover Study

oversight_info.authority: United States: Food and Drug Administration

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.study_design: Endpoint Classification: Safety/Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Single Group Assignment, Masking: Open Label, Primary Purpose: Treatment
